description: Alternative form of welsh, from Welsh.

entries.meaning: A person who defaults on an obligation, especially a small one.
examples: She's a welch. That watering-can isn't hers: I lent it to her three years ago.

verbs.description: welch (third-person singular simple present welches, present participle welching, simple past and past participle welched)

entries.meaning: To fail to repay a small debt.
To fail to fulfill an obligation.
examples: I welched. I'm a welcher. Didn't I tell you?
